markets.longDesc: A unique Tokyo neighborhood street lined with 80+ tiny restaurants specializing in monjayaki ‚Äî Tokyo's gooey, savory answer to Osaka's okonomiyaki.

markets.name: Hakodate Morning Market
markets.desc: 250 vendors from dawn, DIY nokke-don, fresh crab, squid fishing tank
markets.longDesc: A bustling dawn market with 250 vendors selling ultra-fresh Hokkaido seafood, a famous DIY rice bowl alley, and a tank where you can fish for live squid.

markets.name: Nijo Market
markets.desc: Sapporo's 100-year-old seafood market, king crab, scallops, uni bowls
markets.longDesc: Sapporo's century-old market overflowing with Hokkaido king crab, giant scallops, and fresh uni bowls ‚Äî the best place to taste Hokkaido's seafood bounty.

markets.name: Tatehana Wharf Morning Market
markets.desc: Japan's largest morning market, 300+ vendors, Hachinohe port, fish auctions
markets.longDesc: Japan's biggest morning market with 300+ vendors selling just-caught fish at Hachinohe port, plus live auctions and a spectacular senbei-jiru soup breakfast.

markets.name: Furukawa Fish Market
markets.desc: DIY nokke-don in Aomori, ticket-based fish-topping system, since 1941
markets.longDesc: An Aomori market famous for its unique nokke-don system where you buy tickets and build your own seafood rice bowl by choosing toppings from different vendors.

markets.name: Foodever
markets.desc: UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy food hall, Tsuruoka, Shonai regional cuisine
markets.longDesc: A curated food hall in UNESCO-recognized Tsuruoka showcasing Shonai region's extraordinary indigenous vegetables, local sake, and the cuisine that earned the designation.

markets.name: Nakano Broadway
markets.desc: Eight-floor vintage complex, anime, retro cameras, rare collectibles
markets.longDesc: A legendary eight-story complex in Nakano that's paradise for collectors ‚Äî vintage cameras, rare anime figures, retro games, and quirky finds on every floor.

markets.name: Yanaka Ginza
markets.desc: Nostalgic retro shotengai, cat-themed shops, local bakeries, old Tokyo charm
markets.longDesc: A charming retro shopping street preserving old Tokyo character with family-run shops, cat-themed everything, artisan bakeries, and a golden sunset stairway view.

markets.name: Ameya-Yokocho
markets.desc: Ueno's bustling discount market street, snacks, spices, chaotic energy
markets.longDesc: A frenetic Ueno market alley crammed with discount vendors, exotic spices, dried fruits, candy shops, and street food ‚Äî pure chaotic Tokyo energy.

markets.name: Dotonbori Food Stalls
markets.desc: Osaka's neon-lit street food mecca, takoyaki stands, glico sign, grilled everything
markets.longDesc: Osaka's most famous entertainment strip where neon-lit takoyaki stands, okonomiyaki grills, and gyoza vendors create Japan's most exhilarating street food scene.

markets.longDesc: Japan's most prestigious depachika with exquisitely packaged wagashi, artisanal bento, seasonal confections, and gift-worthy food from every region of Japan.

markets.name: Takashimaya Food Hall

markets.longDesc: An upscale Nihonbashi food hall featuring meticulously curated gourmet prepared dishes, premium Hokkaido dairy, and beautifully wrapped artisanal food gifts.

a.name: Classic Japan: Tokyo to Kyoto (10 Days)
a.description: Experience the essential soul of Japan from neon-lit Tokyo temples to Kyoto's ancient gardens, savoring world-class sushi, soaking in mountain hot springs, and discovering the perfect rhythm between ancient tradition and cutting-edge modernity.
